chunks.content: The first degrees from the college were awarded in 1849. The university was expanded with new buildings to accommodate more students and faculty.

metadata.topic: Founding and Expansion of the University

chunks.content: With each new president, new academic programs were offered and new buildings built to accommodate them. The original Main Building built by Sorin just after he arrived was replaced by a larger 'Main Building' in 1865, which housed the university's administration, classrooms, and dormitories.
Beginning in 1873, a library collection was started by Father Lemonnier. By 1879 it had grown to ten thousand volumes that were housed in the Main Building.
